result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony M Marunowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft by Contractor <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 779.02(5).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution Hearing will be held June 11, 2019 @ 3:45PM.

DE will pay restitution of $6074.00 or as determined at the restitution hearing to be held 6-11-19 @ 3:45PM. 

DE will have no contact with the victims.

DE will have no self employment in Rusk County.

DE will comply with all conditions recommended by DOC Agent.  

DE will pay court costs, provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

State has no objection to early release from probation after serving 12 months if all restitution and court costs have been paid in full. 

DE will have credit for 7 days if revoked.

Bond money will be applied to restitution owed.

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

supervisions.notes: DE informs the court all financial obligations have been satisfied.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

03:32 PM Defendant Anthony M Marunowski in court with attorney Samuel Louis Lawton.  Defendant Anthony M Marunowski in custody.  Lester H Liptak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony M Marunowski appeared by video means with Attorney.  Heard along with 2016CM24, 2017CM112. Court has colloquy with DE on his right to personal appearance versus via ZOOM, DE has no objection to proceeding via ZOOM, court will accept waiver. No additions or corrections to revocation packet from either side.  3:36PM argument entered by the State. State asking for 6 months on each count, concurrent.  3:40 DE makes a statement to the court. DE informs the court that all financial obligations/restitution have been paid.  3:42PM Atty Lawton argues for a time served sentence.  

2016CM24-Court will order 6 months jail

2017CM112-six months jail, concurrent.  DE will have credit for 118 days served.  Adj 3:53PM.
